Source code for pycamtrap.core.constants

"""Constants module for default values.

This module holds all default values for simulator configuration.

Attributes
----------
GLOBAL_CONSTANTS : dict
    This dictionary holds all default values unrelated to movement generation,
    such as the initial conditions generator, default camera configuration
    variables, etc...

MOVEMENT_PARAMETERS : dict
    This dictionary holds default values for any movement model. When extending
    the :py:class:`pycamtrap.movement_models.basemodel.MovementModel` this
    parameters will be added to the model parameters if no replacement is
    provided.

"""

GLOBAL_CONSTANTS = {
    'range': 20,
    'min_clusters': 2,
    'max_clusters': 10,
    'min_neighbors': 1,
    'max_neighbors': 10,
    'resolution': 0.1,
    'max_iters': 10,
    'hr_days': 365,
    'days': 365,
    'cone_range': 0.01,
    'cone_angle': 60,
    'season': 90,
}

# CONSTANTS FOR MOVEMENT MODELS
MOVEMENT_PARAMETERS = {
    'steps_per_day': 4,
    'velocity': {
        'alpha': 0.0,
        'beta': 1.0},
    'home_range': {
        'alpha': 35.0,
        'exponent': 0.54},
    'density': {
        'alpha': 0.0,
        'hr_exp': 1.2,
        'density_exp': 1.75,
        'niche_size_exp': 1.75},
    'movement': {}
}



[docs]def handle_global_constants(params):
    """Return global constants but replace with provided ones."""
    if params is None:
        params = {}
    copy = GLOBAL_CONSTANTS.copy()
    copy.update(params)
    return copy
